column4: Hey guys the alternate installation disk 9.10 amd64 fails on RAID disks .. any work arounds or what ...?
if you don't get an answer in this channel you might also want to try in #ubuntu-server, they typically have more experience with RAID hardware
hey good point, thanks didn't think of that
short answer -- Ubuntu doesn't update versions, unless there is a security fix -- use a PPA or backports if you want to upgrade programs
ah .. so where do I find instructions for installing Firefox 3.6 on Karmic?
Cool, thanks for the link .. the link says "Firefox 3.6 stable" .. what does stable mean?
there is also a Daily Build PPA out there
nah that's ok, I have used your link and got it working :) Thank you

Are you still there? I followed your instructions, and all I have now is a "Special transitional package for firefox 3.6" but none of the real stuff .. what do I do after following the instructions on the link you sent?
not sure man...  I can try in a VM if you'd like.
oh wait I think I need to do a apt-get upgrade and apt-get dist-upgrade following that
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:mozillateam/firefox-stable && sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install firefox-3.6 worked for me?
and guess what, it lost the java plug in that it had earlier :(
how do I do that? dpkg-reconfigure sun-java6-plugin doesn't work
after installing ff3.6 how did you start it?

I did what you did, apt-get upgrade, apt-get dist-upgrade. This removed my old firefox, and all references now point to new firefox. This new firefox doesn't have Java plugin. Do I report this as a bug or what?
perhaps reverting back to old firefox is a better idea?  don't think there is an integrated way to report bugs from PPA installs of programs.
